Storage.summary: The Storage interface of the Web Storage API provides access to a particular domain's session or local storage. It allows, for example, the addition, modification, or deletion of stored data items.

remarks.para: To manipulate, for instance, the session storage for a domain, a call to is made; whereas for local storage the call is made to .

StorageClear.summary:
The clear() method of the
interface clears all keys stored in a given Storage object.

StorageGetItem.summary:
The getItem() method of the
interface, when passed a key name, will return that key's value, or null if
the key does not exist, in the given Storage object.
StorageGetItem.returns:
A string containing the value of the key. If the key does not exist,
null is returned.

StorageKey.summary:
The key() method of the interface,
when passed a number n, returns the name of the nth key in a given Storage
object. The order of keys is user-agent defined, so you should not rely on it.
StorageKey.returns:
A string containing the name of the key. If the index does not exist,
null is returned.

StorageLength.summary:
The length read-only property of the
interface returns the number of data items stored in a given
Storage object.
StorageLength.value: The number of items stored in the Storage object.

StorageRemoveItem.summary:
The removeItem() method of the
interface, when passed a key name, will remove that key from the given
Storage object if it exists.
The Storage interface of the Web Storage API provides access to a
particular domain's session or local storage.

remarks.para: If there is no item associated with the given key, this method will do nothing.

StorageSetItem.summary:
The setItem() method of the
interface, when passed a key name and value, will add that key to the given
Storage object, or update that key's value if it already exists.
